content.description: Begin climbing the incipient crack out of the left wall below the square black roof. The crux arrives quickly and introduces some cool exposure near your belay with good but particular placements. Enjoy an easy roof exit and thin-seam-stemming to the top. Anchored belay.
content.protection: A full rack from #.3 through #2, Small Nuts, Runners
content.location: In the middle of the People's Court is a section of darker (almost black) rock; the start is under a large black roof.

content.description: An excellent warm-up for the People's Court. Face climbing moves you casually out of the roof and onto the positive holds of the Stick It to the Man corner. Reach a ledge below the top and share finishes with Tell It to the Judge.
content.protection: Fingers with supplemental small sizes. A couple of hand sizes, and runners.
content.location: A shared bolted belay starts in the same location as Tell It to the Judge under the obvious two-exit black roof; this route exits the right side of this roof.

content.description: From the bolted belay, gain the crux quickly via positive face holds and a couple of less than obvious gear placements. Execute a boulder sequence with more strange protection before enjoying moderate climbing to the rim.
content.protection: A single rack, nuts, and runners. And one Orange Metolius!
content.location: In the middle of the People's Court, left of the Black Roof. Bolted belay is within view from the Volunteer Wash Overlook.

content.description: From the belay ledge, take a hard left through the roof crack. Establish yourself below the splitter and get ready for the business. A few desperate thin hand and finger locks lead you to jugs. From here the route splits into two different corners. Go right for fingers and jugs. Go left for hands.
content.location: Shares a belay with JMo Goes to Trial. Rap off large pine tree to a small ledge. Currently has no fixed belay (we used the rap line) but should have bolts soon.

content.description: From the belay, cross-examine your way through the exciting roof. The prosecution rests at the stance below the stem box. Work your way up with thin fingers and good feet. Make your closing argument on tips locks and wait for the verdict.
content.location: Rap off large pine tree to a chalked up ledge that is big enough to stand on. Currently has no fixed anchor (we used the rap line). Should have bolts soon.

content.description: Start on a small ledge a body length below a square shaped block. Pull the roof and follow an intermittent seam with the occasional jam, but mainly face climbing on thin gear. The crack gradually steepens and widens to thin hands.
content.location: Rap off closest juniper to the rim.

content.description: Ultra Classic! An overhanging start on impeccable black stone bears striking similarities to Paradise Forks' famous 'Black Rose,' before reaching a ledge below a nothing less than perfect big hands to tight hands splitter up a left facing corner. A Dead Giveaway!
content.protection: Fingers to Big Hands with emphasis on the bigger hand sizes. Nuts and Runners.
content.location: The farthest right route at the People's Court. The Dead Giveaway splitter that goes almost to the ground.

content.description: This golden wall is allot like the Yogi wall at the forks. Great rock and minimal lichen. These routes are a bit shorter than most at Volunteer. Very easy to identify routes as it is a 2min walk to the other side of the canyon.
